text: Over My Dead Body is a Canadian documentary film, directed by Brigitte Poupart and released in 2012."Over My Dead Body: retenir son souffle". La Presse, February 25, 2012. The film is a portrait of Dave St-Pierre, a dancer and choreographer from Montreal who is urgently awaiting a lung transplant due to his lifelong battle with cystic fibrosis. The film premiered in February 2012 at the Rendez-vous Québec Cinéma."Soixante-huit films seront presentes en première aux RVCQ: 68 films presentes en première aux RVCQ". Canadian Press, February 8, 2012. The film was a Canadian Screen Award nominee for Best Feature Length Documentary at the 1st Canadian Screen Awards,"A look at the nominees for the Canadian Screen Awards". Canadian Press, January 15, 2013. and won the Prix Jutra for Best Documentary Film at the 15th Jutra Awards."Jutra Awards soiree fails to elicit much drama; Rebelle the big winner while Michel Cote takes home lifetime achievement award". Montreal Gazette, March 18, 2013. ==References== ==External links== * Category:2012 films Category:2012 documentary films Category:Canadian films Category:Canadian documentary films Category:Quebec films
